modules.module_comment:
Class-to-variable index for unified CSS generation.

Builds an index mapping CSS class names to the CSS variables they use.
This enables the unified generator to include theme variables needed
by the utility classes actually used in the project.

Provides per-file caching with content hash validation to avoid

Built-in CSS class definitions combining token classes and composites.

Token classes map to CSS variables (design tokens).
For other CSS properties, use CSS-literal syntax like `display:flex` or `position:absolute`.

declarations.name: ExtractionResult
declarations.doc_comment:
Extraction result with classes mapped to their source locations.
Uses `null` instead of empty collections to avoid allocation overhead.

Uses embedded diagnostics (rather than a Result type) because file extraction
can partially succeed: some classes may be extracted while others produce errors.
This differs from  which uses a discriminated union
because single-class parsing is binary success/failure.
declarations.type_signature: ExtractionResult

properties.name: classes
properties.doc_comment:
Map from class name to locations where it was used, or null if none.
Keys = unique classes, values = locations for diagnostics/IDE integration.

properties.name: explicit_classes
properties.doc_comment:
Classes explicitly annotated via `@fuz-classes` comments, or null if none.
These should produce warnings if they can't be resolved during generation.

properties.name: tracked_vars
properties.doc_comment: Variables that were used in class contexts, or null if none

properties.name: diagnostics
properties.doc_comment: Diagnostics from the extraction phase, or null if none

properties.name: elements
properties.doc_comment:
HTML elements found in the file, or null if none.
Used for including only the style.css rules needed.

properties.name: css_variables
properties.doc_comment:
CSS variables referenced in style attributes/directives, or null if none.
Used for including only the theme variables needed.
Variable names are stored without the `--` prefix.

declarations.name: SourceIndex
declarations.doc_comment:
Helper class for converting character offsets to line/column positions.
Svelte template nodes (Comment, Text, ExpressionTag) only have char offsets,
so this class enables efficient conversion.

Build: O(n) where n = source length
Lookup: O(log m) where m = number of lines (binary search)

modules.module_comment:
AST-based CSS class extraction for Svelte and TypeScript files.

Replaces regex-based extraction with proper parsing to handle:
- `class="display:flex"` - string attributes
- `class={{ active, disabled: !enabled }}` - object attributes (Svelte 5.16+)
- `class={[cond && 'box', 'display:flex']}` - array attributes (Svelte 5.16+)
- `class:active={cond}` - class directives
- `clsx('foo', { bar: true })` - class utility function calls
- Variables with class-related names
- `// @fuz-classes class1 class2` - comment hints for dynamic classes

declarations.name: modified_class_interpreter
declarations.doc_comment:
Interpreter for modified token/composite classes (e.g., `hover:p_md`, `md:box`, `dark:hover:panel`).
Applies modifiers to existing declaration-based or ruleset-based classes.

This interpreter must run BEFORE css_literal_interpreter to handle cases like `hover:box`
where `box` is a known class (not a CSS property).
declarations.type_signature: CssClassDefinitionInterpreter

declarations.name: css_literal_interpreter
declarations.doc_comment:
Interpreter for CSS-literal classes (e.g., `display:flex`, `hover:opacity:80%`).
Generates full CSS rulesets including any modifier wrappers.
declarations.type_signature: CssClassDefinitionInterpreter

declarations.name: css_class_interpreters
declarations.doc_comment:
Collection of all builtin interpreters for dynamic CSS class generation.
Order matters: modified_class_interpreter runs first to handle `hover:box` before
css_literal_interpreter tries to interpret it as `hover:box` (property:value).
declarations.type_signature: CssClassDefinitionInterpreter[]

declarations.doc_comment: Result from resolving a `composes` array to combined declarations.
declarations.type_signature: ResolveComposesResult

declarations.name: resolve_class_definition
declarations.doc_comment:
Resolves a class definition's declaration, handling `composes` composition.

If the definition has a `composes` property, resolves those classes recursively
and combines with any explicit `declaration`. If no `composes`, returns the
explicit `declaration` directly.
declarations.type_signature: (def: CssClassDefinitionStatic, class_name: string, definitions: Record<string, CssClassDefinition | undefined>, css_properties?: Set<...> | null): ResolveComposesResult
declarations.return_description: Combined declaration or an error

parameters.name: class_name
parameters.description: - The name of the class being resolved (for error messages)

parameters.name: definitions
parameters.description: - Record of all known class definitions

parameters.name: css_properties
parameters.description: - Set of valid CSS properties for literal validation, or null to skip

declarations.name: resolve_composes
declarations.doc_comment:
Resolves an array of class names to their combined CSS declarations.

Recursively resolves nested `composes` arrays and combines all declarations.
Validates that referenced classes exist and are resolvable (not rulesets or interpreters).
Supports unmodified CSS literals (e.g., `text-align:center`) in the composes array.

Deduplication behavior:
- Diamond dependencies (class reached via different composition branches) are silently skipped
- Redundant listings (class already included by an earlier sibling in this array) emit a warning
declarations.type_signature: (class_names: string[], definitions: Record<string, CssClassDefinition | undefined>, resolution_stack: Set<string>, visited: Set<string>, original_class_name: string, css_properties?: Set<...> | null): ResolveComposesResult
declarations.return_description: Combined declarations or an error

parameters.name: class_names
parameters.description: - Array of class names to resolve

parameters.name: definitions
parameters.description: - Record of all known class definitions

parameters.name: resolution_stack
parameters.description: - Set of class names currently being resolved (for cycle detection)

parameters.name: visited
parameters.description: - Set of all class names already resolved (for deduplication)

parameters.name: original_class_name
parameters.description: - The class name being defined (for error messages)

parameters.name: css_properties
parameters.description: - Set of valid CSS properties for literal validation, or null to skip

modules.module_comment:
CSS class resolution utilities for composing class definitions.

Provides the `resolve_composes` helper to recursively resolve class names
to their combined CSS declarations.

declarations.name: CssClasses

Collection of CSS classes extracted from source files.
Tracks classes per-file for efficient incremental updates.
Handles include/exclude filtering and explicit class tracking.
Uses `null` instead of empty collections to avoid allocation overhead.

Replaces any previous classes and diagnostics for this file.
members.type_signature: (id: string, classes: Map<string, SourceLocation[]> | null, explicit_classes?: Set<string> | null | undefined, diagnostics?: ExtractionDiagnostic[] | null | undefined, elements?: Set<...> | ... 1 more ... | undefined, css_variables?: Set<...> | ... 1 more ... | undefined): void

parameters.name: css_variables

members.name: get
members.doc_comment: Gets all unique class names as a Set (with exclude filter applied).

members.name: get_with_locations

Gets all classes with their source locations (with exclude filter applied).

members.name: get_all
members.doc_comment:
Gets all classes and their locations in a single call.
More efficient than calling `get()` and `get_with_locations()` separately
when both are needed (avoids potential double recalculation).

Results have exclude filter applied and explicit_classes includes additional_classes.
members.type_signature: (): { all_classes: Set<string>; all_classes_with_locations: Map<string, SourceLocation[] | null>; explicit_classes: Set<string> | null; all_elements: Set<...>; all_css_variables: Set<...>; }

declarations.name: CssLiteralParseResult
declarations.doc_comment:
Result of parsing a CSS-literal class name.

Uses a discriminated union (Result type) because parsing a single class
is binary: it either succeeds or fails entirely. This differs from
 which uses embedded diagnostics because file
extraction can partially succeed (some classes extracted, others have errors).

Uses `| null` for diagnostics to avoid allocating empty arrays.
Callers should use a guard pattern: `if (result.diagnostics) { ... }`
declarations.type_signature: CssLiteralParseResult

  Pass `null` to skip validation.

declarations.name: suggest_css_property
declarations.doc_comment: Suggests a correct property name for a typo using Levenshtein distance.
declarations.type_signature: (typo: string, properties: Set<string> | null): string | null
declarations.return_description: The suggested property or null if no close match (Levenshtein distance > 2)

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description:
- Set of valid CSS properties from `load_css_properties()`.
  Pass `null` to skip suggestions.

declarations.name: suggest_modifier
declarations.doc_comment: Suggests a correct modifier name for a typo using Levenshtein distance.
declarations.type_signature: (typo: string): string | null
declarations.return_description: The suggested modifier or null if no close match (Levenshtein distance > 2)

declarations.name: format_css_value
declarations.doc_comment:
Formats a CSS-literal value for CSS output.
- Replaces `~` with space
- Ensures space before `!important`
declarations.type_signature: (value: string): string
declarations.return_description: Formatted CSS value

declarations.name: check_calc_expression
declarations.doc_comment: Checks if a value contains a possibly invalid calc expression.
declarations.type_signature: (value: string): string | null
declarations.return_description: Warning message if suspicious, null otherwise

declarations.name: is_possible_css_literal
declarations.doc_comment:
Checks if a class name could be a CSS-literal class.
Quick check before attempting full parse.
declarations.type_signature: (class_name: string): boolean
declarations.return_description: True if it could be CSS-literal syntax

declarations.name: extract_segments
declarations.doc_comment:
Extracts colon-separated segments from a class name, handling parentheses.
Parenthesized content (like function arguments) is kept intact.
declarations.type_signature: (class_name: string): string[]

declarations.name: extract_and_validate_modifiers
declarations.doc_comment:
Extracts and validates modifiers from the beginning of a segments array.
Modifiers are consumed from the front until a non-modifier segment is found.

Used by both CSS-literal parsing and modified class interpretation.
declarations.type_signature: (segments: string[], class_name: string): ModifierExtractionResult
declarations.return_description: ModifierExtractionResult with modifiers and remaining segments, or error

parameters.name: class_name
parameters.description: - Original class name for error messages

declarations.name: parse_css_literal
declarations.doc_comment: Parses a CSS-literal class name into its components.
declarations.type_signature: (class_name: string, css_properties: Set<string> | null): CssLiteralParseResult
declarations.return_description: CssLiteralParseResult with parsed data or error

parameters.name: css_properties
parameters.description:
- Set of valid CSS properties from `load_css_properties()`.
  Pass `null` to skip property validation.

declarations.name: generate_selector
declarations.doc_comment:
Generates the CSS selector for a parsed CSS-literal class.
Includes state pseudo-classes and pseudo-element in the selector.
declarations.type_signature: (escaped_class_name: string, parsed: ParsedCssLiteral): string

declarations.name: generate_declaration
declarations.doc_comment: Generates the CSS declaration for a parsed CSS-literal class.
declarations.type_signature: (parsed: ParsedCssLiteral): string

declarations.name: CssLiteralOutput
declarations.doc_comment: Information needed to generate CSS output for a CSS-literal class.
declarations.type_signature: CssLiteralOutput

properties.name: declaration
properties.doc_comment: CSS declaration (property: value;)

properties.name: selector
properties.doc_comment: Full CSS selector including pseudo-classes/elements

properties.name: media_wrapper
properties.doc_comment: Media query wrapper if any

properties.name: ancestor_wrapper
properties.doc_comment: Ancestor wrapper if any

declarations.name: interpret_css_literal
declarations.doc_comment:
Interprets a CSS-literal class and returns CSS generation info.

Callers should first check `is_possible_css_literal()` to filter non-CSS-literal classes.
declarations.type_signature: (class_name: string, escaped_class_name: string, css_properties: Set<string> | null): InterpretCssLiteralResult
declarations.return_description: Result with output and warnings on success, or error on failure

parameters.name: escaped_class_name
parameters.description: - The CSS-escaped version of the class name

parameters.name: css_properties
parameters.description:
- Set of valid CSS properties from `load_css_properties()`.
  Pass `null` to skip property validation.

declarations.name: LiteralResolutionResult
declarations.doc_comment: Result of attempting to resolve a CSS literal for composition.
declarations.type_signature: LiteralResolutionResult

declarations.name: has_modifiers
declarations.doc_comment: Checks if a parsed CSS literal has any modifiers.
declarations.type_signature: (parsed: ParsedCssLiteral): boolean

declarations.name: has_extracted_modifiers
declarations.doc_comment:
Checks if extracted modifiers contain any modifier.
Useful for tooling that needs to detect modified classes.
declarations.type_signature: (modifiers: ExtractedModifiers): boolean

declarations.name: try_resolve_literal
declarations.doc_comment:
Attempts to resolve a class name as an unmodified CSS literal for composition.

Used by `resolve_composes` to support literals in `composes` arrays.
Returns the declaration if successful, null if not a literal, or an error
if it's a literal with issues (modifiers, invalid property, etc.).
declarations.type_signature: (class_name: string, css_properties: Set<string> | null, context_class_name: string): LiteralResolutionResult
declarations.return_description: Resolution result with declaration, or error, or null if not a literal

parameters.name: class_name
parameters.description: - The class name to try resolving

parameters.name: css_properties
parameters.description: - Set of valid CSS properties, or null to skip validation

parameters.name: context_class_name
parameters.description: - The class being defined (for error messages)

declarations.name: generate_css_literal_simple
declarations.doc_comment:
Generates simple CSS for a CSS-literal class (without grouping).
Used by the interpreter for basic output.
declarations.type_signature: (output: CssLiteralOutput): string
declarations.return_description: CSS string for this class

modules.module_comment:
CSS-literal syntax parser, validator, and interpreter.

Enables writing utility classes using actual CSS syntax:

- `display:flex` â†’ `.display\:flex { display: flex; }`
- `hover:opacity:80%` â†’ `.hover\:opacity\:80\%:hover { opacity: 80%; }`
- `md:dark:hover:before:opacity:80%` â†’ nested CSS with media query, ancestor, state, pseudo-element

@see {@link https://github.com/fuzdev/fuz_css} for documentation

declarations.name: CssExtractionOptions
declarations.doc_comment:
Options for CSS class extraction from source files.
Controls which files to scan and how to parse them.
declarations.type_signature: CssExtractionOptions

properties.name: filter_file
properties.doc_comment:
Filter function to determine which files to extract classes from.
By default, extracts from .svelte, .html, .ts, .js, .tsx, .jsx files,
excluding test files and .gen files.

properties.name: acorn_plugins
properties.doc_comment:
Additional acorn plugins for parsing.
Use `acorn-jsx` for React/Preact/Solid projects.

declarations.name: CssClassOptions
declarations.doc_comment:
Options for CSS class definitions and interpretation.
Controls how classes are defined and how dynamic classes are generated.
declarations.type_signature: CssClassOptions

properties.name: class_definitions
properties.doc_comment:
Additional class definitions to merge with defaults.
User definitions take precedence over defaults with the same name.
Required when `include_default_classes` is `false`.

properties.name: include_default_classes
properties.doc_comment:
Whether to include default class definitions (token and composite classes).
When `false`, `class_definitions` is required.

properties.name: class_interpreters
properties.doc_comment:
Custom interpreters for dynamic class generation.
Replaces the builtin interpreters entirely if provided.

properties.name: additional_classes
properties.doc_comment:
Classes to always include in the output, regardless of detection.
Useful for dynamically generated class names that can't be statically extracted.

properties.name: exclude_classes
properties.doc_comment:
Classes to exclude from the output, even if detected.
Useful for filtering out false positives from extraction.

declarations.name: BaseCssOption
declarations.doc_comment:
Type for the base_css option used by CSS generators.
Supports four forms:
- `undefined` - Use default style.css
- `null` - Disable base styles entirely
- `string` - Custom CSS to replace defaults
- `(default_css) => string` - Callback to modify default CSS
declarations.type_signature: BaseCssOption

declarations.name: VariablesOption
declarations.doc_comment:
Type for the variables option used by CSS generators.
Supports four forms:
- `undefined` - Use default variables
- `null` - Disable theme generation entirely
- `Array<StyleVariable>` - Custom variables array (replaces defaults)
- `(defaults) => Array<StyleVariable>` - Callback to modify defaults
declarations.type_signature: VariablesOption

declarations.name: CssOutputOptions
declarations.doc_comment:
Options for CSS output generation (theme + base + utilities).
Controls how the three CSS layers are combined.
declarations.type_signature: CssOutputOptions

properties.name: base_css
properties.doc_comment:
Base styles (element defaults) configuration.
- `undefined` (default): Use default style.css
- `null`: Disable base styles entirely
- `string`: Custom CSS to replace defaults
- `(default_css) => string`: Callback to modify default CSS

properties.name: variables
properties.doc_comment:
Theme variables configuration.
- `undefined` (default): Use default variables from fuz_css
- `null`: Disable theme entirely
- `Array<StyleVariable>`: Custom variable definitions (replaces defaults)
- `(defaults) => Array<StyleVariable>`: Callback to modify default variables

properties.name: treeshake_base_css
properties.doc_comment:
Whether to tree-shake base styles to only include rules for detected elements.
When false, includes all rules from the base styles.

properties.name: treeshake_variables
properties.doc_comment:
Whether to tree-shake theme variables to only include those referenced.
When false, includes all variables.

properties.name: theme_specificity
properties.doc_comment:
Specificity multiplier for theme CSS selectors.
Value of 1 generates `:root`, higher values generate more specific selectors (e.g., `:root:root`).

properties.name: additional_elements
properties.doc_comment:
Additional HTML elements to always include styles for.
Useful for elements generated at runtime via `document.createElement()`.

properties.name: additional_variables
properties.doc_comment:
Additional CSS variables to always include in theme output.
Useful for variables referenced dynamically.

declarations.name: CssDiagnosticsOptions
declarations.doc_comment: Options for error and warning handling.
declarations.type_signature: CssDiagnosticsOptions

properties.name: on_error
properties.doc_comment:
How to handle CSS-literal errors during generation.
- 'log': Log errors, skip invalid classes, continue
- 'throw': Throw on first error, fail the build

properties.name: on_warning
properties.doc_comment:
How to handle warnings during generation.
- 'log': Log warnings, continue
- 'throw': Throw on first warning, fail the build
- 'ignore': Suppress warnings entirely

declarations.name: CssCacheOptions
declarations.doc_comment: Options for cache behavior.
declarations.type_signature: CssCacheOptions

properties.name: cache_dir
properties.doc_comment: Cache directory relative to project root.

properties.name: ops
properties.doc_comment:
Filesystem operations for cache management.
Defaults to production implementation. Override for testing.

declarations.name: CssGeneratorBaseOptions
declarations.doc_comment:
Combined base options shared by both Gro and Vite plugins.
These options work identically in both contexts.
declarations.type_signature: CssGeneratorBaseOptions

modules.module_comment:
Shared options for CSS generation plugins (Gro and Vite).

Both `gen_fuz_css` (Gro generator) and `vite_plugin_fuz_css` share
the same core options for extraction, generation, and unified CSS.
This module provides the shared types to ensure consistency.

declarations.name: ParsedRule
declarations.doc_comment: A parsed CSS rule with its components and positions.
declarations.type_signature: ParsedRule

properties.name: selector
properties.doc_comment: Full selector string (e.g., ".box", ".selectable:hover")

properties.name: selector_start
properties.doc_comment: Start position of selector in original CSS (0-indexed)

properties.name: selector_end
properties.doc_comment: End position of selector in original CSS

properties.name: declarations
properties.doc_comment: The declarations block (without braces)

properties.name: rule_start
properties.doc_comment: Start position of the entire rule

properties.name: rule_end
properties.doc_comment: End position of the entire rule

declarations.name: ParsedRuleset
declarations.doc_comment: Result of parsing a CSS ruleset.
declarations.type_signature: ParsedRuleset

properties.name: rules
properties.doc_comment: All rules in the ruleset

declarations.name: parse_ruleset
declarations.doc_comment: Parses a CSS ruleset string using Svelte's CSS parser.
declarations.type_signature: (css: string): ParsedRuleset
declarations.return_description: ParsedRuleset with structured rule data and positions

declarations.name: is_single_selector_ruleset
declarations.doc_comment:
Checks if a ruleset has only a single simple selector (just the class name).
Used to detect rulesets that could be converted to declaration format.
declarations.type_signature: (rules: ParsedRule[], escaped_class_name: string): boolean
declarations.return_description: True if there's exactly one rule with selector ".class_name"

declarations.name: ruleset_contains_class
declarations.doc_comment:
Checks if any selector in the ruleset contains the expected class name.
Used to validate that ruleset definitions match their key.
declarations.type_signature: (rules: ParsedRule[], escaped_class_name: string): boolean
declarations.return_description: True if at least one selector contains ".class_name"

declarations.name: extract_css_comment
declarations.doc_comment:
Extracts the CSS comment from a ruleset (if any).
Looks for comments before the first rule.
declarations.type_signature: (css: string, rules: ParsedRule[]): string | null
declarations.return_description: Comment text without delimiters, or null if no comment

declarations.name: SkippedModifierInfo
declarations.doc_comment:
Information about a modifier that was skipped for a selector during ruleset modification.
The selector is still included in output, just without the conflicting modifier applied.
declarations.type_signature: SkippedModifierInfo

properties.name: selector
properties.doc_comment: The specific selector where the modifier was skipped (not the full selector list)

properties.name: reason
properties.doc_comment: Reason the modifier was skipped

properties.name: conflicting_modifier
properties.doc_comment: The conflicting modifier that was not applied (e.g., "::before" or ":hover")

declarations.name: ModifiedSelectorGroupResult
declarations.doc_comment:
Result from modifying a selector group with conflict detection.

Uses `| null` for skipped_modifiers to avoid allocating empty arrays.
Callers should use a guard pattern: `if (result.skipped_modifiers) { ... }`
declarations.type_signature: ModifiedSelectorGroupResult

properties.name: selector
properties.doc_comment: The modified selector list as a string

properties.name: skipped_modifiers
properties.doc_comment: Information about modifiers skipped for specific selectors, or null if none

declarations.name: ModifiedRulesetResult
declarations.doc_comment:
Result from generating a modified ruleset.

Uses `| null` for skipped_modifiers to avoid allocating empty arrays.
Callers should use a guard pattern: `if (result.skipped_modifiers) { ... }`
declarations.type_signature: ModifiedRulesetResult

properties.name: css
properties.doc_comment: The generated CSS

properties.name: skipped_modifiers
properties.doc_comment: Information about modifiers that were skipped for certain rules, or null if none

declarations.name: split_selector_list
declarations.doc_comment: Splits a selector list by commas, respecting parentheses, brackets, and quoted strings.
examples:
split_selector_list('.a, .b') â†’ ['.a', '.b']
split_selector_list('.a:not(.b), .c') â†’ ['.a:not(.b)', '.c']
split_selector_list('.a[data-x="a,b"], .c') â†’ ['.a[data-x="a,b"]', '.c']
declarations.type_signature: (selector_group: string): string[]

declarations.name: find_compound_end
declarations.doc_comment:
Finds the end position of the compound selector containing the class at class_pos.
A compound selector is a sequence of simple selectors without combinators.
declarations.type_signature: (selector: string, class_pos: number): number
declarations.return_description: Position where state modifiers should be inserted (before any pseudo-element)

declarations.name: modify_single_selector
declarations.doc_comment: Modifies a single CSS selector to add modifiers.
declarations.type_signature: (selector: string, original_class: string, new_class_escaped: string, state_css: string, pseudo_element_css: string): string
declarations.return_description: Modified selector

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: - A single CSS selector (not a selector list)

declarations.name: modify_selector_group
declarations.doc_comment:
Modifies a selector list (comma-separated selectors) to add modifiers.
Handles conflicts per-selector: if one selector in a list has a conflict,
only that selector skips the modifier; other selectors still get it.
declarations.type_signature: (selector_group: string, original_class: string, new_class_escaped: string, states_to_add: string[], pseudo_element_css: string): ModifiedSelectorGroupResult
declarations.return_description: Result with modified selector list and information about skipped modifiers

declarations.name: generate_modified_ruleset
declarations.doc_comment:
Generates CSS for a modified ruleset with applied modifiers.

Conflict handling is per-selector within selector lists:
- For `.plain:hover, .plain:active` with `hover:` modifier, only `.plain:hover` skips
  the `:hover` addition; `.plain:active` still gets `:hover` appended.
- For multiple states like `:hover:focus`, each is checked individually; conflicting
  states are skipped while non-conflicting ones are still applied.
declarations.type_signature: (original_ruleset: string, original_class: string, new_class_escaped: string, state_css: string, pseudo_element_css: string, media_wrapper: string | null, ancestor_wrapper: string | null): ModifiedRulesetResult
declarations.return_description: Result with generated CSS and information about skipped modifiers

parameters.name: new_class_escaped
parameters.description: - The escaped new class name with modifiers

modules.module_comment:
CSS ruleset parser using Svelte's CSS parser.

Parses CSS rulesets to extract selectors and declarations with position information.
Used for:
- Phase 0a: Detecting single-selector rulesets that could be converted to declaration format
- Phase 2: Modifying selectors for modifier support on composite classes

declarations.name: CssResolutionStats

properties.name: elements
properties.doc_comment: List of HTML element names included

properties.name: included_rules

properties.name: total_rules
properties.doc_comment: Total number of rules in style.css

properties.name: variable_count
properties.doc_comment: Number of CSS variables resolved (including transitive deps)

declarations.name: CssResolutionResult
declarations.doc_comment: Result from CSS resolution.
declarations.type_signature: CssResolutionResult

properties.name: theme_css
properties.doc_comment: CSS for theme variables (light and dark)

properties.name: base_css
properties.doc_comment: CSS for base styles (from style.css)

properties.name: resolved_variables
properties.doc_comment: All resolved variable names (including transitive deps)

properties.name: included_rule_indices
properties.doc_comment: Indices of rules included from the style index

properties.name: included_elements
properties.doc_comment: Element names that were matched

properties.name: diagnostics
properties.doc_comment: Diagnostics from resolution

properties.name: stats
properties.doc_comment: Resolution statistics (only when include_stats is true)

declarations.name: CssResolutionOptions
declarations.doc_comment: Options for CSS resolution.
declarations.type_signature: CssResolutionOptions

properties.name: style_rule_index
properties.doc_comment: Index of style.css rules

properties.name: variable_graph
properties.doc_comment: Dependency graph for theme variables

properties.name: class_variable_index
properties.doc_comment: Index mapping classes to variables

properties.name: detected_elements
properties.doc_comment: HTML elements detected in source files

properties.name: detected_classes
properties.doc_comment: CSS classes detected in source files

properties.name: detected_css_variables
properties.doc_comment: CSS variables directly referenced in source files

properties.name: utility_variables_used
properties.doc_comment: CSS variables used by generated utility classes

properties.name: additional_elements
properties.doc_comment: Additional elements to always include

properties.name: additional_variables
properties.doc_comment: Additional variables to always include

properties.name: theme_specificity
properties.doc_comment: Specificity multiplier for theme selector (default 1)

properties.name: include_stats
properties.doc_comment: Whether to include resolution statistics in result

properties.name: warn_unmatched_elements
properties.doc_comment: Warn when detected elements have no matching style rules (default false)

properties.name: treeshake_base_css
properties.doc_comment:
Whether to tree-shake base styles to only include rules for detected elements.
When false, includes all rules from the style index.

properties.name: treeshake_variables
properties.doc_comment:
Whether to tree-shake theme variables to only include those referenced.
When false, includes all variables from the variable graph.

declarations.name: resolve_css
declarations.doc_comment:
Resolves which CSS to include based on detected usage.

Algorithm:
1. Collect rules: core rules + element-matching + class-matching
2. Collect variables: from rules, class defs, utility generation, detected vars, additional_variables
3. Resolve transitive variable dependencies
4. Generate output: theme_css (light+dark), base_css (source order)
declarations.type_signature: (options: CssResolutionOptions): CssResolutionResult
declarations.return_description: Resolution result with theme CSS, base CSS, and diagnostics

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: - Resolution options including indexes, detected usage, and config

declarations.name: GenerateUnifiedCssOptions
declarations.doc_comment: Options for unified CSS output generation.
declarations.type_signature: GenerateUnifiedCssOptions

properties.name: include_theme
properties.doc_comment: Include theme variables section.

properties.name: include_base
properties.doc_comment: Include base styles section.

properties.name: include_utilities
properties.doc_comment: Include utility classes section.

declarations.name: generate_unified_css
declarations.doc_comment: Generates combined CSS output from resolution result.
declarations.type_signature: (result: CssResolutionResult, utility_css: string, options?: GenerateUnifiedCssOptions): string
declarations.return_description: Combined CSS string

modules.module_comment:
CSS resolution algorithm for unified CSS generation.

Combines theme variables, base styles, and utility classes into a single
unified output. Resolves which CSS rules and variables to include based
on what elements and classes are actually used in the project.

declarations.name: extract_css_variables
declarations.doc_comment:
Extracts CSS variable names from a CSS string.

Parses `var(--name)` patterns and returns the variable names
without the `--` prefix. Handles fallback values by extracting
only the primary variable reference.
declarations.type_signature: (css: string): Set<string>
declarations.return_description: Set of variable names (without `--` prefix)

declarations.name: has_css_variables
declarations.doc_comment:
Checks if a CSS string contains any CSS variable references.

More efficient than `extract_css_variables` when you only need
to know if variables exist, not what they are.
declarations.type_signature: (css: string): boolean
declarations.return_description: True if the string contains `var(--*)` patterns

modules.module_comment:
CSS variable extraction utilities.

Provides shared helper functions for extracting CSS custom property references
from CSS strings. Used by style_rule_parser, variable_graph, class_variable_index,
and css_class_generation.

modules.module_comment:
Diagnostic types for CSS class extraction and generation.

Provides a unified diagnostic system across all phases:
- Extraction: Parsing source files to find class names
- Generation: Producing CSS output from class definitions

modules.module_comment:
Example CSS class exports demonstrating node_modules extraction.

This module exists to verify that the Vite plugin extracts classes from
dependencies in node_modules. The exports test specific extraction patterns
that require being in a separate module.

**Important:** Variable names must match `CLASS_NAME_PATTERN` in css_class_extractor.ts.
Supported suffixes: `class`, `classes`, `className`, `classNames`, `classList`, `classLists`
(also snake_case variants like `class_name`, `class_names`, `class_list`, `class_lists`).

**Patterns demonstrated:**
- Naming patterns: All CLASS_NAME_PATTERN suffix variants
- Expression patterns: Ternary, logical AND, arrays
- Comment hints: `@fuz-classes` directive

Token, composite, and literal classes are demonstrated inline in the examples
since they don't require special extraction testing.

Excludes files in test directories (/test/, /tests/, /__tests__/, /__mocks__/).

modules.module_comment:
[Gro generator](https://github.com/ryanatkn/gro) for creating optimized utility CSS from extracted class names.
Scans source files, extracts CSS classes with AST-based parsing, and generates
only the CSS for classes actually used. Includes per-file caching with content
hash validation for fast incremental rebuilds.

Computes SHA-256 hash of content using Web Crypto API.
Use for file content hashing where async is acceptable.

declarations.name: compute_hash_sync
declarations.doc_comment:
Computes a simple synchronous hash for content-based cache invalidation.
Uses DJB2 algorithm - not cryptographic, just for comparison.
Use for in-memory content where sync is preferred (variable graphs, etc).
declarations.type_signature: (str: string): string
declarations.return_description: Hex-encoded hash

Extracts content from balanced parentheses after a prefix.
Supports nested parens for calc(), clamp(), min(), max(), etc.

declarations.return_description: The content inside the balanced parens, or null if no match/unbalanced

parameters.description: - The prefix before the opening paren (e.g., "min-width")

declarations.name: parse_arbitrary_breakpoint
declarations.doc_comment:
Parses an arbitrary breakpoint modifier.
Supports nested parentheses for calc(), clamp(), min(), max(), var().
Requires value to start with a digit or known CSS function to catch obvious mistakes.
examples:
parse_arbitrary_breakpoint("min-width(800px)") // "@media (width >= 800px)"
parse_arbitrary_breakpoint("min-width(calc(100vw - 200px))") // "@media (width >= calc(100vw - 200px))"
parse_arbitrary_breakpoint("min-width(px)") // null (invalid - no digit or function)
declarations.type_signature: (segment: string): string | null
declarations.return_description: The CSS media query or null if not an arbitrary breakpoint

modules.module_comment:
Declarative modifier definitions for CSS-literal syntax.

Modifiers enable responsive, state-based, and contextual styling:
- Media modifiers: `md:`, `print:`, `motion-safe:`
- Ancestor modifiers: `dark:`, `light:`
- State modifiers: `hover:`, `focus:`, `disabled:`
- Pseudo-element modifiers: `before:`, `after:`

@see {@link https://github.com/fuzdev/fuz_css} for documentation

Parses the fuz_css style.css file into a structured index that maps

the unified CSS generator to include only the rules needed for
elements actually used in the project.
